Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Unguent \Un"guent\ (?; 277), n. [L. unguentum, from unguere, ungere, to anoint: cf. F. onguent. See {Ointment}, and cf. {Unction}, {Unctuous}.] A lubricant or salve for sores, burns, or the like; an ointment. --Cowper. [1913 Webster]
Note: An unguent is stiffer than a liniment, but softer than a cerate. [1913 Webster]
unguent n : semisolid preparation (usually containing a medicine) applied externally as a remedy or for soothing an irritation [syn: {ointment}, {unction}, {balm}, {salve}]
